keyword: how many calories in a green pepper
title: How Many Calories in a Green Pepper?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a green pepper, including carbs, fiber, vitamins, and nutrition breakdown per medium size, with tweaks for cooking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Green Pepper?
assumptions: Medium green bell pepper (~119 g), raw, whole (without seeds/stem).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium green pepper has about 24 kcal and is low in fat with good fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Stuffed with ground beef (add 100 g cooked)

faqs.q: How many calories in a green pepper?
faqs.a: About 24 kcal for one medium raw green bell pepper.
Yes, one medium has ~5.5 g carbs, including 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a green pepper?
faqs.a: Roughly 1 g protein per medium green pepper.
Very low—only 0.2 g total fat per medium pepper, no saturated or trans fat.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in green peppers?
faqs.a: Smaller peppers (~74 g) have ~15 kcal; larger (~164 g) around 33 kcal.
